title: Quantum Modules of Semipositive Toric Varieties
abstract:
A smooth projective toric variety $X=X_\Sigma$ has a geometric quotient
description $V /\!/ T$. Using $2|1$-pointed quasimap invariants, one can define
a quantum $H^*(T)$-module $QM(X)$, which deforms a natural module structure
given by the Kirwan map $H^*(T) \rightarrow H^*(X)$. The Batyrev ring of $X$,
defined from combinatorial data of the fan $\Sigma$, has its natural module
structure given by the quotient of a polynomial ring, say BatM$(X)$. In this
paper, we prove that $QM(X)$ and BatM$(X)$ are naturally isomorphic when $X$ is
semipositive.
